title: spec negation operator !
body:
<!--*Please add a concise summary of your suggestion here.*-->
Enable the use of a negation operator in spec dependencies.

### Rationale

<!--*Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe it!*-->
It may be viable to never allow a package to use a specific library version for various reasons. Sometimes libraries gets released which then turns out to break API/ABI and a new release is made soon after. But this is not always apparent to end-users or package maintainers.

### Description

<!--*Describe the solution you'd like and the alternatives you have considered.*-->

From the [spec dependency list](https://spack.readthedocs.io/en/latest/basic_usage.html#specs-dependencies).
For instance to select a version between 1.2 and 1.4, but not 1.3.2 one would do:
```
# current syntax
mpileaks @1.2:1.3.1,1.3.3:1.4 %gcc@4.7.5 +debug -qt target=x86_64 ^callpath @1.1 %gcc@4.7.2
# suggested syntax
mpileaks @1.2:1.4,!1.3.2 %gcc@4.7.5 +debug -qt target=x86_64 ^callpath @1.1 %gcc@4.7.2
```
Since you are already using `^` and `~` it is best if `!` would be used for this (it seems).
